body.header: Questions 5-10. Listen to the recording, which will play automatically, and follow the instructions. Complete the flow chart below. Write NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS for each answer.
body.section:
Setting up a web site
Step 1. Find a reliable Internet Service Provider (ISP).Step 2. Acquire (5) Step 3. Look at (6) Step 4. Determine what the purpose of the web site is and who (7) Step 5. Collect (8) Step 6. Test on a low specification computer with a (9) Step 7. Test on different configurations of computer software and server. Step 8. Set up your web site once but (10)

section.p: You should be able to tell from the title of the flow chart and the information provided that you will hear someone talking about how to set up a web site.
Question 5What part of speech do you think can follow 'acquire'? What do you think you need to acquire when setting up a web site? What words of similar meaning can you think of for 'acquire'?
Question 6What do you think you should 'look at' before creating your site? What would you do? What other words or phrases might you hear instead of 'look at'?
Question 7The stem of this sentence should help you. What do you think the 'who' could refer to, a business? Who are the people involved?
Question 8Think about other words for 'collect'. Any ideas about what you might need to collect?
Question 9In this question you are given the stem, which helps you when you are listening. Make sure you understand what is written here.
Question 10The 'but' in this statement should help you. The advice is to do something 'once' so maybe you have to do something else more frequently?
